Key Match Events: Yankees third baseman Jazz Chisholm Jr. accused the Royals' Maikel Garcia of intentionally trying to hurt Anthony Volpe while sliding into second base during Game 4 of a tense AL Division Series that New York clinched with a 3-1 victory.
Tempers flared and both teams flooded the field after Garcia slid hard into the base and Volpe delivered a hard tag on the Kansas City third baseman.
Yankees starter Gerrit Cole allowed a lone run over seven innings of precise pitching.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm expressed his displeasure with Maikel Garcia's actions, stating he would stick up for his teammates.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone made a light-hearted comment comparing the incident to past rivalries between the teams.
Royals manager Matt Quatraro provided a straightforward explanation of the incident, acknowledging the chippy nature of postseason baseball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees and Royals have a long-standing rivalry dating back to the 1970s, often involving intense and sometimes physical games.
